revised_title: A Case Study of Kidney Stones and Pregnancy
tldr: A woman with a history of side and stomach pains passed three kidney stones during her 11-12th week of pregnancy. The stones were all the same color, weight, and size, leading the author to break only one for examination. The woman recovered and gave birth to a healthy baby girl. This case study highlights the connection between kidney stones and pregnancy complications.
scientific_discipline: Medicine and Health Sciences > Obstetrics and Gynecology
